verses.text: And the men of Ephraim said unto him, Why hast thou served us thus , that thou calledst us not, when thou wentest to fight with the Midianites ? And they did chide with him sharply.\f + \fr 8.1 \ft Why…: Heb. What thing is this thou hast done unto us\f*\f + \fr 8.1 \ft sharply: Heb. strongly\f*
And he said unto them, What have I done now in comparison of you? \add Is\add* not the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim better than the vintage of Abi-ezer ?

God hath delivered into your hands the princes of Midian , Oreb and Zeeb : and what was I able to do in comparison of you? Then their anger was abated toward him, when he had said that.\f + \fr 8.3 \ft anger: Heb. spirit\f* \p
¶ And Gideon came to Jordan , \add and\add* passed over , he, and the three hundred men that \add were\add* with him, faint , yet pursuing \add them\add*.
And he said unto the men of Succoth , Give , I pray you, loaves of bread unto the people that follow me; for they \add be\add* faint , and I am pursuing after Zebah and Zalmunna , kings of Midian. \p
¶ And the princes of Succoth said , \add Are\add* the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thine hand , that we should give bread unto thine army ?

And Gideon said , Therefore when the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into mine hand , then I will tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness and with briers.\f + \fr 8.7 \ft tear: Heb. thresh\f* \p
¶ And he went up thence to Penuel , and spake unto them likewise : and the men of Penuel answered him as the men of Succoth had answered \add him\add*.
And he spake also unto the men of Penuel , saying , When I come again in peace , I will break down this tower. \p

¶ Now Zebah and Zalmunna \add were\add* in Karkor , and their hosts with them, about fifteen thousand \add men\add*, all that were left of all the hosts of the children of the east : for there fell an hundred and twenty thousand men that drew sword.\f + \fr 8.10 \ft men that…: or, every one drawing a sword\f* \p
¶ And Gideon went up by the way of them that dwelt in tents on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah , and smote the host : for the host was secure.
And when Zebah and Zalmunna fled , he pursued after them, and took the two kings of Midian , Zebah and Zalmunna , and discomfited all the host.\f + \fr 8.12 \ft discomfited: Heb. terrified\f* \p
¶ And Gideon the son of Joash returned from battle before the sun \add was up\add*,

And caught a young man of the men of Succoth , and enquired of him: and he described unto him the princes of Succoth , and the elders thereof, \add even\add* threescore and seventeen men.\f + \fr 8.14 \ft described: Heb. writ\f*

And he came unto the men of Succoth , and said , Behold Zebah and Zalmunna , with whom ye did upbraid me, saying , \add Are\add* the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thine hand , that we should give bread unto thy men \add that are\add* weary ?
And he took the elders of the city , and thorns of the wilderness and briers , and with them he taught the men of Succoth.\f + \fr 8.16 \ft taught: Heb. made to know\f*
And he beat down the tower of Penuel , and slew the men of the city. \p

¶ Then said he unto Zebah and Zalmunna , What manner of men \add were they\add* whom ye slew at Tabor ? And they answered , As thou \add art\add*, so \add were\add* they; each one resembled the children of a king.\f + \fr 8.18 \ft resembled…: Heb. according to the form, etc\f*
And he said , They \add were\add* my brethren , \add even\add* the sons of my mother : \add as\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* liveth , if ye had saved them alive , I would not slay you.
And he said unto Jether his firstborn , Up , \add and\add* slay them. But the youth drew not his sword : for he feared , because he \add was\add* yet a youth.

Then Zebah and Zalmunna said , Rise thou, and fall upon us: for as the man \add is, so is\add* his strength. And Gideon arose , and slew Zebah and Zalmunna , and took away the ornaments that \add were\add* on their camels’ necks.\f + \fr 8.21 \ft ornaments: or, ornaments like the moon\f* \p
¶ Then the men of Israel said unto Gideon , Rule thou over us, both thou, and thy son , and thy son’s son also: for thou hast delivered us from the hand of Midian.
And Gideon said unto them, I will not rule over you, neither shall my son rule over you: the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall rule over you. \p
¶ And Gideon said unto them, I would desire a request of you, that ye would give me every man the earrings of his prey. (For they had golden earrings , because they \add were\add* Ishmaelites.)
And they answered , We will willingly give \add them\add*. And they spread a garment , and did cast therein every man the earrings of his prey.

And the weight of the golden earrings that he requested was a thousand and seven hundred \add shekels\add* of gold ; beside ornaments , and collars , and purple raiment that \add was\add* on the kings of Midian , and beside the chains that \add were\add* about their camels’ necks.\f + \fr 8.26 \ft collars: or, sweet jewels\f*
And Gideon made an ephod thereof, and put it in his city , \add even\add* in Ophrah : and all Israel went thither a whoring after it: which thing became a snare unto Gideon , and to his house. \p
¶ Thus was Midian subdued before the children of Israel , so that they lifted up their heads no more. And the country was in quietness forty years in the days of Gideon. \p
¶ And Jerubbaal the son of Joash went and dwelt in his own house.
And Gideon had threescore and ten sons of his body begotten : for he had many wives.\f + \fr 8.30 \ft of his…: Heb. going out of his thigh\f*
And his concubine that \add was\add* in Shechem , she also bare him a son , whose name he called Abimelech.\f + \fr 8.31 \ft called: Heb. set\f* \p
¶ And Gideon the son of Joash died in a good old age , and was buried in the sepulchre of Joash his father , in Ophrah of the Abi-ezrites.
And it came to pass, as soon as Gideon was dead , that the children of Israel turned again , and went a whoring after Baalim , and made Baal-berith their god.
And the children of Israel remembered not the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* their God , who had delivered them out of the hands of all their enemies on every side :
Neither shewed they kindness to the house of Jerubbaal , \add namely\add*, Gideon , according to all the goodness which he had shewed unto Israel.
